Experience

Kyambura Gorge Lodge is a former coffee plantation & estate located at the foot of the Rwenzori Mountains & the Queen Elizabeth National Park.
This lush park is Uganda’s flagship big game park & home to the endangered chimpanzees & rare tree-climbing lions. Excellent bird watching can also be expected since the area has 610 different bird species.
Other wildlife such as buffalo, elephant, hippo, leopard, no fewer than 10 primate species & many antelope species can also be found here.

Stay

There are 8 unique, luxury bandas at Kyambura Gorge Lodge, of which one is ideal for honeymooners or families looking for peace & privacy.
Each banda features an en-suite bathroom with a private balcony offering breathtaking views of the park.
The central lodge area includes an inviting saltwater swimming pool with expansive views, a restaurant as well as a tranquil massage room that offers one 30-minute complimentary massage per guest per stay.

Activities

Kyambura Gorge Lodge has a variety of activities on its menu. Some of these include guided chimpanzee trekking in Kyambura Gorge & Kalinzu Forest, game drives through the park & boat cruises along the famous Kazinga Channel where excellent sightings of hippo, crocodile & bird species are seen at the water’s edge.
Guided walks, bird watching or a community coffee tour can also be arranged. Here guests will see the transformation of coffee beans into delicious Ugandan coffee – all done by hand.
Another highlight is to join a scientific researcher on his daily game drive in the park to locate & record the behaviour of a lion pride he is studying.

subfolders.title: Ishasha Wilderness Camp
subfolders.description: Ishasha Wilderness Camp enjoys a remote setting on the banks of the Ntungwe River in the southern sector of Queen Elizabeth National Park. This intimate tented camp is ideal for romantics looking for a peaceful stay or nature lovers who appreciate an off-the-beaten-track experience.

subfolders.title: Kyaninga Lodge
subfolders.description: Overlooking the breathtaking Lake Kyaninga lies one of Uganda’s most luxurious resorts outside the capital – Kyaninga Lodge.   This ideal lake location offers spectacular views & since it is nearby the town of Fort Portal, it has easy access to amazing hiking trails with views of the Great Rift Valley & Rwenzori Mountains.

subfolders.title: Mweya Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Located deep in Queen Elizabeth National Park - Uganda’s premier big game destination - lies Mweya Safari Lodge. Perched on a peninsula above the Kazinga Channel & surrounded by the Rwenzori Mountains, this timber & thatch safari lodge offers breathtaking views from all its rooms.

whatWeLoveItems: Spectacular views of the gorge & mountains
